results.title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
results.creator_credit: Happinet Pictures, Kadokawa Pictures, Memory Tech, Q-Tec, Toki wo Kakeru Shôjo Seisaku Iinkai 2006, Madhouse, Sound Box, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Takafumi Watanabe, Jungo Maruta, Mamoru Hosoda, Yuichiro Saito and Satoko Okudera
results.brief_description: When 17-year-old Makoto Konno gains the ability to, quite literally, “leap” backwards through time, she immediately sets about improving her grades and preventing personal mishaps. However, she soon realises that changing the past isn’t as simple as it seems, and eventually, will have to rely on her new powers to shape the future of herself and her friends.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Happinet Pictures, Kadokawa Pictures, Memory Tech, Q-Tec, Toki wo Kakeru Shôjo Seisaku Iinkai 2006, Madhouse, Sound Box, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Takafumi Watanabe, Jungo Maruta, Mamoru Hosoda, Yuichiro Saito and Satoko Okudera
results.description: When 17-year-old Makoto Konno gains the ability to, quite literally, “leap” backwards through time, she immediately sets about improving her grades and preventing personal mishaps. However, she soon realises that changing the past isn’t as simple as it seems, and eventually, will have to rely on her new powers to shape the future of herself and her friends.

results.title: The Girl on the Train
results.creator_credit: Reliance Entertainment, DreamWorks Pictures, Marc Platt Productions, Amblin Partners, Erin Cressida Wilson, Ann Roth, Michelle Matland, Jared LeBoff, Marc Platt, Kevin Thompson and Tate Taylor
results.brief_description: Rachel Watson, devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day, until one morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Reliance Entertainment, DreamWorks Pictures, Marc Platt Productions, Amblin Partners, Erin Cressida Wilson, Ann Roth, Michelle Matland, Jared LeBoff, Marc Platt, Kevin Thompson and Tate Taylor
results.description: Rachel Watson, devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day, until one morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds.

results.title: The Gang's All Here
results.brief_description: Playboy Andy Mason, on leave from the army, romances showgirl Edie Allen overnight to such effect that she’s starry-eyed when he leaves next morning for active duty in the Pacific. Song and dance hilarity follows.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

results.description: Playboy Andy Mason, on leave from the army, romances showgirl Edie Allen overnight to such effect that she’s starry-eyed when he leaves next morning for active duty in the Pacific. Only trouble is, he gave her the assumed name of Casey. Andy’s eventual return with a medal is celebrated by his rich father with a benefit show featuring Eadie’s show troupe, at which she’s sure to learn his true identity…and meet Vivian, his ‘family-arrangement’ fiancée. Mostly song and dance.
description_for_label: Playboy Andy Mason, on leave from the army, romances showgirl Edie Allen overnight to such effect that she’s starry-eyed when he leaves next morning for active duty in the Pacific. Only trouble is, he gave her the assumed name of Casey. Andy’s eventual return with a medal is celebrated by his rich father with a benefit show featuring Eadie’s show troupe, at which she’s sure to learn his true identity…and meet Vivian, his ‘family-arrangement’ fiancée. Mostly song and dance.

results.title: The Games
results.brief_description: The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

constellations_other.name: No guts, no glory
constellations_other.description: TV arrived just in time for the 1956 Melbourne Olympics. The Olympics crystallise ideas of nationalism, athletic heroism, and controversy, all of which have been explored through countless features, documentaries and TV shows.

results.description:
The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

‘The Games’ starred satirists John Clarke and Bryan Dawe along with Australian comedian Gina Riley and actor Nicholas Bell. It was written by John Clarke and Ross Stevenson. The series centred on the Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games and satirised corruption and cronyism in the Olympic movement, bureaucratic ineptness in the New South Wales public service, and unethical behaviour within politics and the media. An unusual feature of the show was that the characters shared the same name as the actors who played them, to enhance the illusion of a documentary on the Sydney Games.
description_for_label:
The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

‘The Games’ starred satirists John Clarke and Bryan Dawe along with Australian comedian Gina Riley and actor Nicholas Bell. It was written by John Clarke and Ross Stevenson. The series centred on the Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games and satirised corruption and cronyism in the Olympic movement, bureaucratic ineptness in the New South Wales public service, and unethical behaviour within politics and the media. An unusual feature of the show was that the characters shared the same name as the actors who played them, to enhance the illusion of a documentary on the Sydney Games.

results.title: The Frog Prince
results.brief_description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

results.description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955: others include The Gallant Little Tailor, Hänsel and Gretel, Sleeping Beauty and Snow White and Rose Red.
description_for_label: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955: others include The Gallant Little Tailor, Hänsel and Gretel, Sleeping Beauty and Snow White and Rose Red.

results.title: The Four Troublesome Heads
results.brief_description: Un homme de têtes (The Four Troublesome heads) is an 1898 French silent film directed by Georges Méliès. The film features one of the first known uses of multiple exposure of objects on a black background on film, a special effect Méliès went on to use prolifically.
results.description: Un homme de têtes (The Four Troublesome heads) is an 1898 French silent film directed by Georges Méliès. The film features one of the first known uses of multiple exposure of objects on a black background on film, a special effect Méliès went on to use prolifically.
description_for_label: Un homme de têtes (The Four Troublesome heads) is an 1898 French silent film directed by Georges Méliès. The film features one of the first known uses of multiple exposure of objects on a black background on film, a special effect Méliès went on to use prolifically.

results.title: The Fifth Estate
results.creator_credit: Participant Media, Reliance Entertainment, Touchstone Pictures, Anonymous Content, DreamWorks Pictures, Steve Golin, Bill Condon, Michael Sugar and Josh Singer
results.headline_credit: Belgium, India and United States of America, 2013
results.brief_description: A look at the relationship between WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange and his early supporter and eventual colleague Daniel Domscheit-Berg, and how the website’s growth and influence led to an irreparable rift between the two friends.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Participant Media, Reliance Entertainment, Touchstone Pictures, Anonymous Content, DreamWorks Pictures, Steve Golin, Bill Condon, Michael Sugar and Josh Singer

results.description: A look at the relationship between WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange and his early supporter and eventual colleague Daniel Domscheit-Berg, and how the website’s growth and influence led to an irreparable rift between the two friends.

results.title: The Fifth Element
results.brief_description: In 2257, a taxi driver is unintentionally given the task of saving a young girl who is part of the key that will ensure the survival of humanity.
results.description: In 2257, a taxi driver is unintentionally given the task of saving a young girl who is part of the key that will ensure the survival of humanity.
description_for_label: In 2257, a taxi driver is unintentionally given the task of saving a young girl who is part of the key that will ensure the survival of humanity.

results.title: The Favourite
results.headline_credit: Ireland, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: England, early 18th century. The close relationship between Queen Anne and Sarah Churchill is threatened by the arrival of Sarah’s cousin, Abigail Hill, resulting in a bitter rivalry between the two cousins to be the Queen’s favourite.

constellations_primary.name: Auteurs and Yorgos Lanthimos
constellations_primary.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge!

constellations_other.name: Power and privilege, monarchy and make-up
constellations_other.description: The upper echelons of society explored through colour, make-up and scandal.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

constellations_other.name: Making films in black and white
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

results.headline_credit_for_label: Ireland, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018

results.title: The Family Law
results.brief_description: Through the eyes of 14-year-old Benjamin, and set over the course of a long, hot, Queensland summer, the Law family navigate a series of sometimes disastrous events which become memorable milestones, and serve as a reminder that at the end of the day family can sometimes feel more like a sentence than a choice.
